name: AI Preference Engineering Index
summary: AI-enabled persuasion capacity is high and increasingly concentrated, raising concerns about polarization-by-design and semi-lock dynamics.

components.name: Persuasion Infrastructure Capacity
components.summary: Mature stack: data lakes, ML, and gen-AI tools widely used in comms and campaigns.

components.name: Centralization of Control
components.summary: Practical control of key persuasion channels is concentrated in a small set of state-aligned and corporate platforms.

components.name: Deployment Pattern
components.summary: Regular use for segmented, emotional, and wedge-issue campaigns; some evidence of manipulative tactics.

components.name: Contestability & Counter-speech (raw)
components.summary: Independent media and civil society still exist but operate with structural disadvantages and targeted chilling effects.

components.name: Governance & Safeguards (raw)
components.summary: Partial privacy and platform rules exist but are narrow, under-enforced, or full of carve-outs.

notes: Scores are illustrative alpha values for demonstration purposes.
In a production run, AI_PEI would be calculated from tagged spend, platform rules, and documented campaign usage patterns.
